data.name: Beagle 2
data.notes: Planned landing was Dec. 25, 2003. Communication never re-established after separation from Mars Express orbiter. It was announced in January 2015 that the probe had been found about five km from its target landing site, apparently intact.

data.name: ExoMars 2022
data.notes: Planned touchdown site for ExoMars 2022 Rover and Surface Platform. Coordinates in Oxia Planum per an ESA website page dated September 2019. Originally planned for launch in 2018, but re-scheduled to 2020 due to funding issues and construction delays. Postponed again to 2022 due to insufficient time to complete pre-launch activities.

data.name: ExoMars Schiaparelli
data.notes: Planned landing on Oct. 19, 2016. Coordinates per NASA news release regarding imagery of likely crash site.

data.name: Mars InSight
data.notes: Landed Nov. 26, 2018. Longitude and latitude (p'c) per B. Semenov e-mail Apr. 1, 2019.

data.name: Mars Pathfinder
data.notes: AKA, Carl Sagan Memorial Station. Landed July 4, 1997; last communication Sep. 27, 1977. Coordinates per Kuchynka (2014, doi:10.1016/j.icarus.2013.11.015).

data.name: Mars Perseverance
data.notes: Planned touchdown site for NASA Mars Perseverance rover (aka, Mars 2020) to land February 2021. Coordinates 77.5031E 18.4386N were given in the journal article by Grant et al. (doi:10.1016/j.pss.2018.07.001). A document on the JPL SPICE/NAIF website dated Aug 2018 gave that same longitude as Grant et al. but a Gaussian latitude of 18.642678N (IAU_MARS reference frame). However, a more recent SPICE/NAIF FK document dated June 2019 gives a longitude of 77.429800E and Gaussian latitude 18.670633N. A SCLK document also dated June 2019 gives a Sol 0 epoch that differs by no more than 1 second (as calculated by Mars24) from LMST midnight at longitude 77.429800E.

data.name: Mars Phoenix
data.notes: Landed May 25, 2008. Longitude and latitude (p'c) per D. Bass e-mail May 31, 2008. Prior to post-landing announcement, Mars24 used the "CSZ_032708" target coordinates of 233.975E 68.151N (p'c).

data.name: Mars Polar Lander
data.notes: Planned landing was Dec. 3, 1999. Presumed to have crashed due to premature engine shutdown. Also carried two small Deep Space 2 microprobes to be dropped during descent and which presumably impacted at approx. -196.5°E, 75.0°S.

data.name: MER-A Spirit
data.notes: AKA, Columbia Memorial Station. Landed Jan. 4, 2004; last communication Mar. 22, 2010. Longitude and latitude per Li et al. (2005, doi:10.14358/PERS.71.10.1129). Note that Kuchynka et al. 2014 give coordinates 175.5271E -14.60762N.

data.name: MER-B Opportunity
data.notes: AKA, Challenger Memorial Station. Landed Jan. 25, 2004. Longitude and latitude per Li et al. (2005, doi:10.14358/PERS.71.10.1129). Note that Kuchynka et al. 2014 give coordinates -5.35714E -2.22922N.

data.name: MSL Curiosity
data.notes: AKA, Bradbury Landing. Landed Aug. 6, 2012. Longitude and latitude (p'c) per J. Crisp e-mail Aug. 7, 2012. Vasavada et al. 2014 (doi:10.1002/2014JE004622) provide same values at less fine resolution.

data.name: Viking Lander 1
data.notes: AKA, Thomas Mutch Memorial Station. Landed July 20, 1976; last communication Nov. 13, 1982. Coordinates per Kuchynka (2014, doi:10.1016/j.icarus.2013.11.015).

data.name: Viking Lander 2
data.notes: AKA, Gerald Soffen Memorial Station. Landed Sep. 3, 1976; last communication Apr. 11, 1980. Coordinates per Kuchynka (2014, doi:10.1016/j.icarus.2013.11.015).
